keyword: how many calories in two pieces of bacon
title: How Many Calories in Two Pieces of Bacon?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in two pieces of bacon, including protein, fat, sodium details, per-piece breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in Two Pieces of Bacon?
assumptions: Standard pork bacon, cooked (pan-fried), medium slices (~8 g each), no added oil or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut thickness, cooking method, and fat content. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two pieces of cooked bacon provide ~86 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Baked instead of fried (less fat absorbed)

faqs.q: How many calories per piece of bacon?
faqs.a: About 43 kcal for one medium cooked slice.

faqs.q: What's the protein in two pieces of bacon?
Why is sodium high in bacon?
faqs.a: Curing process adds salt; two pieces have ~384 mg sodium.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”frying retains more fat than baking or microwaving.

faqs.q: How do calories compare for different bacon types?
faqs.a: Pork bacon ~43 kcal/slice; turkey ~28 kcal/slice; vegetarian options vary widely.
